stadium.name: Fletchings Field
stadium.description: Fletchings Field was the first formal Troll Ball stadium in Warden lands. The design balances wood and stone, with arrowhead motifs and banners representing each region under Warden protection. The field includes trees, gully's and other obstacle placements, changed each match by local druids and terrain crafters.

stats.pregame_ritual: Going over the game plan drawn in the dirt with the team captain.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game.
Headbutting their own team's goal post (gently).
Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Burying their helmet in the ground and then digging it back up.
Reading their own fortune in a scattering of knuckle bones.
Wearing a specific, garishly colored pair of undergarments.
Always putting on their left gauntlet before their right.

stadium.name: The Aegis Field
stadium.description: A pristine field within the main temple compound, used as the central training ground for the Shield. The pitch is bordered by the library and monastery, and is said to be protected by the twin lights, Dawn's Hope and Silver Twilight.

stats.pregame_ritual: Tying their bootlaces together and hopping to the starting line.
Re-taping their shield's handle with fresh leather.
Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.
Drinking a full waterskin of lukewarm water.
Drawing a detailed, anatomically incorrect diagram of a troll's head.
Passing a 'team luckstone' from player to player without speaking.
Chewing a specific, bitter root said to improve night vision.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Kissing their biceps and whispering words of encouragement to them.
Trying to teach a stray dog a complicated and useless new trick.
Challenging a spectator to a game of tic-tac-toe in the dirt.

preGame:
# üéôÔ∏è LIVE FROM FLETCHINGS FIELD! üéôÔ∏è

GOOD EVENING, BLOOD SPORTS FANS! You are listening to **Nok the Corrupter**, bringing you the violence, the viscera, and the glorious chaos of **TUESDAY NIGHT TROLLBALL**! We are live from **Fletchings Field**, a lovely little deathtrap filled with gullies, trees, and shifting terrain! The locals say the Druids change the layout every match, but I just assume the ground itself is trying to eat the players! HA!

Tonight, we have a match-up that makes my stomach churn, but for very different reasons! On one side, representing the insufferably shiny Temple of Light, we have **The Haven Lights**! ü§¢ Ugh, I can taste the sanctity from here. Look at them down there‚Äî**Shiroma Salim** is meticulously re-taping his shield handle like he's preparing for a tea party, and **Zwart Bunns** is... whispering his secret fears to the Trollball? Pathetic! Hey Zwart, here's a secret fear for you: MY FIST! 

Facing off against the blinding boredom of the Lights, we have the home team, **Oak & Onslaught**! Now, these folks know how to prepare! **Wynnie Faina** is warming up with their boots on the wrong feet‚Äîthat is the kind of chaotic energy I crave! And listen to that noise! **Milt Casady** is leading a chant that is slowly getting louder, sounding less like a pep talk and more like a summoning ritual! THAT'S WHAT I'M TALKING ABOUT!

Can the Wardens‚Äîunder the watchful eye of **Sir Randy** and his FANCY bow (compensating for something, Randy?)‚Äîdefend their turf? Or will the Haven Lights bore us all to death with their efficiency? Grab your ale, sharpen your axes, and pray for injuries, folks, because TROLLBALL STARTS NOW! üëπüèà
postGame:
# üìª THE AFTERMATH: LIGHT BLINDS THE OAK üìª

Well, folks, sometimes you wake up hoping for a massacre, and you get... a massacre, but the wrong kind! The dust has settled at Fletchings Field, and I am physically ill to report that **The Haven Lights** have shut out **Oak & Onslaught** with a final score of **5 to 0**! DISGUSTING! ü§Æ

The game started with the kind of brutality that usually warms my cold, dead heart. **Dickenson Beker** of the Lights wasted no time, tackling **Hole Bowerman** and sending her straight to the dirt with a nasty injury! That's the spirit! But did Oak & Onslaught capitalize on the chaos? No! They let **Tybi Reo** run straight into the End Zone for a **DUNK**! 1-0 Haven. I bet **Riffle Harrington**, the Haven Healer, was barely sweating yet.

The violence continued back and forth like a beautiful dance of pain. **Hole Bowerman**, fresh from the grave (thanks to Healer **Ahron Latashia**), took out **Wieren Ivar** with a vengeance! That is the circle of life I enjoy watching! You kill me, I kill you, we all laugh about it in the regeneration cycle!

However, the Lights kept the pressure on. **Shiroma Salim**, proving that being literate doesn't make you weak (unfortunately), launched a projectile from the Home 2-Point zone and **SCORED**! A 2-point shot right through the uprights! 3-0 going into Halftime. I spent the break throwing darts at a picture of **Sir Tanos**.

The second half was a bloodbath, mostly courtesy of **Wynnie Faina** for the home team! Wynnie went on a rampage, injuring **Dickenson Beker** AND **Farand Keil**! Now THAT is a highlight reel! If you can't win the game, at least win the body count, I always say! 

Despite the carnage, the Haven Lights just wouldn't stay down. Their healer, **Riffle Harrington**, was working overtime, hopping around with his boots tied together (what a stupid ritual), reviving players left and right. It's annoying how effective they are.

**Ema Ulrick** tried to turn the tide for Oak, snapping **Tybi Reo** in half with a tackle that shook the press box! But did it matter? NO! Because Tybi Reo got up, dusted off the shattered bones, and launched *another* 2-point shot from the Home zone! **SCORE!** 5-0!

And that's how it ended. A complete shutout. The Wardens' defense was about as effective as **Falric**'s financial planning! **Sir Randy** is probably crying into his quiver right now. 

I must admit, watching the Haven Lights win makes my skin crawl, but you have to respect the sheer amount of medical attention required on that field tonight. It was brutal, it was fast, and the wrong team won.

This is **Nok the Corrupter**, signing off and heading to the nearest tavern to drink until I forget the Haven Lights exist! GOODNIGHT OSTERRA! üåëüç∫
